last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3838562
I don't mind it as long as the character's interesting enough. It works particularly well in detective-y settings like the Harrietta Lee or Kate Kane series. The latter has an excellent use of perspective shift in a later book that showcases the internal monologue of a secondary character and endeared them even further to me.

I suppose it draws people out in more mundane settings where the main character might be more plausibly construed (and harder to ignore) as a self-insert of the author. But it needn't be that way.

>>3838154
The time limit for PNC's Battle Pass isn't too bad; you can max it out in a bit less than 3 weeks, while it's open for 4. I think the main thing is to make sure to do the Weekly missions because they reward ~3-5x more activity points than the dailies.

As for the paid Battle Pass, the Monthly Pass is a better deal assuming you don't care about the costume but the Battle Pass is still about 1.5-3x more price efficient than pretty much anything else in the store (again, not counting the costume)

The monthly pass is $5 USD for 300 Quartz and 2400 Quartz Sand, or 22 gacha pulls. Converted fully to Quartz Sand, it totals to 3300 Quartz Sand or 660 Quartz Sand/USD.

The paid Battle Pass includes:
- 1200 Quartz Sand
- 8 Advanced Search Commands (1200 Quartz Sand)
- 800 Keys (400 Quartz Sand)
- 50000 Diggcoin (~83.3 Quartz Sand)
- 180000 Combat EXP (300 Quartz Sand)
- 10000 Skill Samples (~192 Quartz Sand)
- 20 Skill Pivots (100 Quartz Sand)
- 50 Orange Algorithm Boosters (~729 Quartz Sand)
- 5 Reconfiguration Generators (~89 Quartz Sand)
- 250 Neural Kits
- 5 Orange Gifts (~52 Quartz Sand)
- 20 Green, Blue, Purple Breakthrough Widgets (class non-choosable)
- 15 Orange Breakthrough Widgets (choosable class, ~50 Quartz Sand)
- 1 Algorithm Set A-la-Carte Box (~30-60 Quartz Sand)

Altogether, I'd put the Battle Pass rewards at about ~4800 Quartz Sand value, so about 480 Quartz Sand per USD. For comparison, the Quartz Exchange vouchers are optimistically valued at ~360 Quartz Sand/USD (assuming first time bonus and perfect efficiency doing one 50 Quartz pull a day), while the one-off Supply Packs typically stay below 300 Quartz Sand/USD.

If you throw in the costume on top of that, the Battle Pass isn't a bad deal. Still, as stated at the start the Monthly Pass is both a better price and translates to more direct gacha pulls.

>A Day Will Come When You Won't Be
Pairing: Reader/Natasha (Marvel)
link: https://archiveofourown.org/works/39513210/chapters/98899803
Summary: “I’m used to being lonely, but forever to be a stranger is a strange grief.” - Ursula K. Le Guin
Commentary: I have recommended this before (even here!). Basically the 'reader' is a immortal being. Contrary to popular belief, having one true soulmate that keeps reincarnating is pretty fucked up as you get to watch them die over and over again. This is a great read (author doesn't use Y/N once, because that's just bad) albeit it's pretty depressing with a kind of downer ending. Everything from this author is good actually, which is impressive since most of it is, technically, self-insert stuff. Also, first fanfic from Marvel that to me... is actually good. I was browsing the Marvel tag and most of the time is just straight up smut, and not the fun kind.

I would agree with >>3837511 if not for this fic. I'm of the mind that the closer the self-insert is to your own vision the more 'readable' it becomes. So it all comes down to your own standards versus your personality on how the romance should come and go. Since a lot of the writers are teenagers and most of the time it's very indulgent it's really difficult to find what most would consider good self-inserts. But they're out there! We just need to find them (or write them I suppose).

If Joshua only had 2 tips on his tail and managed to give Sakura-san several points, imagine what Lilith could give... I think her points might even be behind the creation of the magical girls.
I wish I could see more succubus demons, I want to know if they're all that powerful or if it's just Shamiko's family. I mean, the magical girls cared enough to seal away their powers and yet Joshua still managed to be strong... They must be from a very important demon bloodline.

It also said 1-3 weeks for some volumes but it shipped everything in 2 days (but Vampeerz is still out of stock). Then FedEx put it out for delivery and at the end of the day brought it back to their warehouse without delivering it. It worried me as hell but then they delivered it the next day.
